root.title: PowerShell
root.header: An A-Z Index of Windows PowerShell commands
item.description: Get permission settings for a file or registry key.
Directory Account, Computer, Group and User cmdlets.
gal Return alias names for Cmdlets.
epal Export currently defined aliases to a file.
ipal Import an alias list from a file.
sal Create or change an alias.
List the app packages installed in a user profile.
Remove an app package from a user account.
Extract files from an archive (zipped) file [PS 5+]
Get the signature object associated with a file.
Place a signature in a .ps1 script or other file.
Enable encryption for a BitLocker volume.
Enable automatic unlocking for a BitLocker volume.
Resume Bitlocker encryption for the specified volume.
Suspend Bitlocker encryption for the specified volume.
Add a key protector for a BitLocker volume.
Remove a key protector from a BitLocker volume.
Get information about volumes BitLocker can protect.
Handle a terminating error within a scriptblock.
Export a certificate from a certificate store into a file.
Submit/retrieve a certificate request to an enrollment server and install.
Import one or more certificates into a certificate store.
cd/chdir/sl Set the current working location.
dir/ls/gci Get child items (contents of a folder or registry key).
cli Remove content from a variable or an alias.
Retrieve CIM instance by an association.
gcls Get a list of CIM classes in a specific namespace.
Subscribe to indications using a filter or query expression.
ncim Create a new instance of a class.
gcim Get a managed resource (storage, network, software etc).
rcim Remove a CIM instance from a computer.
scim Modify a CIM instance on a CIM server.
icim Invoke a method of a CIM class or CIM instance.
gcms Get current CIM session objects.
rcms Remove one or more CIM session objects.
Get the current Windows clipboard entry.
Set the current Windows clipboard entry.
gcm Retrieve basic information about a command.
shcm Create PowerShell commands in a graphical command window.
Add a computer to the domain.
Remove the local computer from a workgroup or domain.
Restart the operating system on a computer.
Restore the computer to a previous state.
Get system and operating system properties.
Reset the machine account password for the computer.
Test and repair the secure channel to the domain.
ac Add to the content of the item.
cat/type/gc Get content from item (specific location).
sc Set content in the item (specific location).
clc Remove content from a file/item.
Skip just this iteration of a loop.
Enable System Restore on a drive.
Disable System Restore on a drive.
Get the restore points on the local computer.
Convert object properties (in CSV format) into CSV objects.
Convert .NET Framework objects into CSV variable-length strings.
Convert a JSON-formatted string to a custom object.
Convert an object to a JSON-formatted string.
Convert the input into an HTML table.
cfs Extract and parse structured properties from a string.
Convert a string containing key and value pairs into a hash table.
Convert a secure string into an encrypted standard string.
Convert an encrypted standard string into a secure string.
copy/cp/ci Copy an item from a namespace location.
Export Performance Counter data to log files.
Get region information (language and keyboard layout).
Set the user culture for the current user account.
Dir/ls/gci Get child items (contents of a folder or registry key).
Set system time on the host system.
Remove all partition information and un-initialize a disk, erasing all data.
Get one or more disks visible to the OS.
Set attributes and update a physical disk.
Initialize a RAW disk for first use, this enables formatting.
Mount a previously created disk image (virtual HD or ISO)
diff/compare Compare the properties of objects.
Retrieve the content of the local DNS client cache.
Clear the content of the DNS client cache.
Get a DNS server IP address from the interface TCP/IP properties.
Set a DNS server IP address on the interface TCP/IP properties.
Perform a DNS name query resolution for a specified name.
Loop while a condition is True.
Get the current config. of a node.
Get Desired State Config. resources from a computer.
Create checksum files for DSC docs/resources.
Apply Desired State config to nodes.
echo Write an object to the pipeline.
Get events in the PowerShell event queue.
Delete events from the event queue.
Wait until a particular event is raised.
Delete all entries from an event log.
Limit the size of the event log.
Create a new event log and a new event source.
Write an event to an event log.
Get the execution policy for the shell.
epal Export currently defined aliases to a file.
Produce a clixml representation of PowerShell objects.
Export console configuration to a file.
epcsv Export to Comma Separated Values (spreadsheet).
Exit Exit PowerShell (or exit a script).
Unblock files downloaded from the Internet.
Compute the hash value for a file.
foreach Loop through each item in the pipeline ( % ).
Loop through each item in a collection.
method Loop through each item in a collection.
Loop through items that match a condition.
fc Format output using a customized view.
fl Format output as a list of properties, each on a new line.
ft Format output as a table.
fw Format output as a table listing one property only.
Save formatting data from the current session.
Get the formatting data in the current session.
gi Get a file/registry object (or any other namespace object).
dir/ls/gci Get child items (contents of a folder or registry key).
Restore one or all GPOs from a GPO backup.
Import Group Policy settings into a specified GPO from a GPO backup.
group Group objects that contain the same value.
Download and install the newest help files on your computer.
Add entries to the session history.
clhy Delete entries from the session history.
history/h/ghy Get a listing of the session history.
r/ihy Invoke a previously executed Cmdlet.
Get host information (PowerShell Version and Region).
oh Send output to the host.
Read a line of input from the host console.
Write customized output to the host/screen.
icim Invoke a method of a CIM class or CIM instance.
Import a clixml file and rebuild the PS object.
ipcsv Take values from a CSV list and send objects down the pipeline.
Import certificates and keys from a Personal Information Exchange(PFX) file.
Specify how PowerShell should handle information stream data.
Get one or more host bus adapter (HBA) initiator ports.
Download and install one or more modules from an online gallery.
Install one or more software packages.
Run commands on local and remote computers.
Get content from a web page.
Send an HTTP or HTTPS request to a RESTful web service.
gi Get a file object or get a registry (or other namespace) object.
ii Invoke an executable or open a file (START).
md/mkdir/ni Create a new item in a namespace.
si Change the value of an item.
clp Remove the property value from a property.
cpp Copy a property along with it's value.
gp Retrieve the properties of an object.
mp Move a property from one location to another.
rp Remove a property and its value.
rnp Renames a property at its location.
sp Set a property at the specified location to a specified value.
gpv Get the value for one or more properties of a specified item.
gjb Get PowerShell background jobs that are running.
rcjb Get PowerShell background job results.
rjb Delete a PowerShell background job.
sajb Start a PowerShell background job.
spjb Stop a PowerShell background job.
wjb Wait for a background job.
Trigger cmdlets Get/Set Scheduled job triggers.
Generate a new root key for the MS.Group KdsSvc within AD.
Add and remove items from a collection.
Add members to a local group.

pwd / gl Get and display the current location.
popd Set the current working location from the stack.
pushd Push a location to the stack.
cd/chdir/sl Set the current working location.
Add a member to an instance of a PowerShell object.
gm Enumerate the properties of an object.
Display a message box to the user
Find modules from an online gallery.
gmo Get the modules imported to the session.
ipmo Add a module to the session.
nmo Create a new dynamic module (only in memory).
rmo Remove a module from the current session.
Save a module locally without installing it.
Get installed modules on a computer.
mv/move/mi Move an item from one location to another.
Get the basic network adapter properties.

Display diagnostic information for a connection.

Create and configure an IP address.

Create a route in the IP routing table.
diff/compare Compare the properties of objects.
group Group objects that contain the same value.
Measure the properties of an object.
sort Sort objects by property value.
Filter the objects passed along the command pipeline.
ogv Send output to an interactive table.
oh Send output to the host.
lp Send the output to a printer.
Send objects to the host as strings.
Return a list of all software packages installed using Package Management.
Find software packages in available package sources.
Uninstall one or more software packages.
Install one or more Package Management package providers.
Return a list of partition objects.
Create a new partition on an existing Disk object.

cvpa Convert a ps path to a provider path.
Combine a path and one or more child-paths.
rvpa Resolves the wildcards in a path.
Return true if the path exists, otherwise return false.
Pause and display the message "Press Enter to continue..."
Invoke Pester to recursively run all tests.
Export a certificate or a PFXData object to a PFX file.

popd Set the current working location from the stack.
pushd Push a location to the stack.
Launch a PowerShell session/run a script.

Attach a debugger to a running process.
start/saps Start one or more processes.
Wait for a process to stop.

dbp Disable a breakpoint in the current console.

gsn Get the PSSessions in the current session.
ipsn Import commands from another session.
nsn Create a persistent connection to a local or remote computer.

ren/rni Change the name of an existing item.

Exit the current scope, (function, script, or script block).

root.header: An A-Z Index of the SQL Server 2005 database
item.description: CHECKALLOC Check consistency of disk allocation.
CHECKCONSTRAINTS Check integrity of table constraints.
CHECKDB Check allocation, and integrity of all objects.
CHECKFILEGROUP Check all tables and indexed views in a filegroup.
CHECKIDENT Check identity value for a table.
CHECKTABLE Check integrity of a table or indexed view.
CLEANTABLE Reclaim space from dropped variable-length columns.
dllname Unload a DLL from memory
DROPCLEANBUFFERS Remove all clean buffers from the buffer pool.
Test for the existence of rows
FREE... CACHE Remove items from cache
INPUTBUFFER Display last statement sent from a client to a database instance.
MASTER KEY / ALTER SERVICE MASTER KEY
MASTER KEY / BACKUP SERVICE MASTER KEY
MASTER KEY / RESTORE SERVICE MASTER KEY
OPENTRAN Display information about recent transactions
OUTPUTBUFFER Display last statement sent from a client to a database instance
PROCCACHE Display information about the procedure cache
SHOW_STATISTICS Display the current distribution statistics
SHRINKDATABASE Shrink the size of the database data and log files.
SHRINKFILE Shrink or empty a database data or log file.
Run a T-SQL statement, procedure or script.
SQLPERF Display transaction-log space statistics. Reset wait and latch statistics.
TRACE... Enable or Disable trace flags
UPDATEUSAGE Report and correct page and row count inaccuracies in catalog views
